title: ICE when compiling rocket = { version = "0.5.0-rc.1", features = ["tls"] } on Mac with nightly

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Minimal example: History: 1040 cargo new Repro_ICE 1041 cd Repro_ICE 1042 rustup override set nightly 1043 code . # edit cargo.toml and add ```[dependencies] rocket = { version = "0.5.0-rc.1", features = ["tls"] } ``` 1044 cargo run ### Code No code modifications needed, hello world can be used to repro ### Meta rustup run nightly rustc --version rustc 1.61.0-nightly (58f11791a 2022-03-17) note: rustc 1.61.0-nightly (58f11791a 2022-03-17) running on x86_64-apple-darwin note: compiler flags: --crate-type lib -C embed-bitcode=no -C split-debuginfo=unpacked -C debuginfo=2 `rustc --version --verbose`: ```rustc 1.61.0-nightly (58f11791a 2022-03-17) binary: rustc commit-hash: 58f11791af4f97572e7afd83f11cffe04bbbd12f commit-date: 2022-03-17 host: x86_64-apple-darwin release: 1.61.0-nightly LLVM version: 14.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` Compiling rocket_codegen v0.5.0-rc.1 thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: !value.has_escaping_bound_vars()', /rustc/58f11791af4f97572e7afd83f11cffe04bbbd12f/compiler/rustc_middle/src/ty/sty.rs:1089:9 ```
Backtrace

``` stack backtrace: 0: _rust_begin_unwind 1: core::panicking::panic_fmt 2: core::panicking::panic 3: rustc_trait_selection::traits::type_known_to_meet_bound_modulo_regions 4: ::enter:: 5: rustc_ty_utils::common_traits::is_item_raw 6: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query::, bool>> 7: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query:: 8: ::is_sized 9: >::layout_of_uncached 10: rustc_middle::ty::layout::layout_of 11: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query:: 12: ::layout_of 13: as rustc_middle::ty::layout::LayoutOf>::layout_of 14: > as alloc::vec::spec_from_iter::SpecFromIter, core::iter::adapters::GenericShunt, >::layout_of_uncached::{closure#5}::{closure#0}>, core::result::Result>>>::from_iter 15: >> as rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#1}> 63: rustc_interface::interface::create_compiler_and_run::, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}> 64: >::set::, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorGuaranteed>> note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.61.0-nightly (58f11791a 2022-03-17) running on x86_64-apple-darwin note: compiler flags: --crate-type lib -C embed-bitcode=no -C split-debuginfo=unpacked -C debuginfo=2 note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [is_sized_raw] computing whether `dyn core::future::future::Future + core::marker::Send` is `Sized` #1 [layout_of] computing layout of `*const dyn core::future::future::Future + core::marker::Send` #2 [layout_of] computing layout of `core::ptr::unique::Unique + core::marker::Send>` #3 [layout_of] computing layout of `alloc::boxed::Box + core::marker::Send>` #4 [layout_of] computing layout of `core::pin::Pin + core::marker::Send>>` end of query stack error: could not compile `rocket` ```
